name: Christine F
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: App wont open anymore. I saw on the news that some states are beginning to eliminate reporting daily covid numbers due to the high amount of declining cases. This could be why the app isn't working anymore.

name: AL G
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: This app is becoming increasingly useless as the number of people getting fully vaccinated increases, and as it fails to gather vaccination data. IF THIS CONDITION CONTINUES, I'LL HAVE NO CHOICE BUT TO UN-INSTALL THIS APP. I SUGGEST THAT OTHERS DO THE SAME. I suggest changing the data that you gather to include: - vaccination info (if obtained, what type, when #1, when #2, etc) - positive/negative test results - self-reported symptoms. All the above can be very useful public health data.

name: Owen Iozzio
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Instantly crashes when launching after latest update

name: Chris Etler
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Since the app came out only 1500 people have even entered their contact tracing number, despite thousands of cases a day. Without proper contact tracing this app is useless

name: Mike Ehrmann
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Stats like deaths and hospitalizations hasn't been updated in a month or more. Other stats are sometimes days late. Information has become useless. What else does this do besides track us?

name: T Sab
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Work in ER, around Covid patients constantly. Never alerted once. So there is clearly not enough user base for this app to be effective.

name: Roibeárd Billson
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Still does not work for me. Tried turning off WiFi & Bluetooth—no difference. Gives "Error 104" —totally unhelpfull. Uninstalling. For those complaining about vaccine being unavailable, well it is NJ. We don't do anything sensibly. In my area, there 3 websites (State, Atlantic Health & RWJ). All are unconnected, so need register on all 3—and wait. Seriously? 😠

name: Donna Phelan
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Ĺeads you to believe it will let you know where to get vaccinated. Nj has the worst system as it relates to vaccines. It so simple, every area code has there own site, if you prove you live in that zip, you can get vaccinated. Its a no brainer, but the state has NO CLUE!!!

name: Bonnie Meigs
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Uninstalling. Does not give exposure alerts. I did not update the app to say I had covid, but the state knows and called me. I don't get exposure notifications when I'm at my house. The whole reason I downloaded this was to be notified of possible exposure and I have never gotten a notification ever. Waste of time.

name: Daniel MacMahon
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Has ANYONE on this review thread been notified of a positive Covid-19 contact? Anyone? I was encouraged to download and use this app when I was first tested in Union County. I checked in with my status every day, for many months. I have NEVER been notified of a potential Covid-19 exposure. As a first responder, I know that I have been within close contact with dozens of Covid-positive people. I have lost confidence that this is a valid weapon against the continuing pandemic.

name: Shawn Roberts
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: This app is useless to users. I've been close, very close, to at least 5 people who have all gotten Covid, none of them caused any notification to my app. I also know that the contact tracers were only asking if they knew about the app, not to do anything to trigger the positive notifications. I know notifications are on because I get one monthly to remind me it's running, well, got one monthly, I have since uninstalled it because it's useless to me as an end user.

name: J Newt
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Absolutely worthless. Contracted covid from a person that contracted covid while in hospital. The contact tracer was not able to get the 6 digit code I needed for the app. Also Drs are refusing to test likely positive people. There's no way to use the app as intended without a test or a code, don't bother with the invasion of privacy.

name: Brian Gallagher
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: I tested positive yesterday, but there is no way to tell the app. I can only report symptoms. Apparently I need a 6 digit code from some health department to let the app know I was positive. So until I get that code nobody who was in proximity to me will get a notification and will therefore keep spreading the 'rona.

name: Penelope Lopez
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Your "ENABLE EXPOSURE ALERT" button has not worked since its launch. Gone into settings > exposure alert > enable and NOTHING. Have an Android phone but know of iPhone users with the same problem. Located in Morris County, NJ. PLEASE FIX THIS!!

name: Ines Bosi
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Don't work!! Just useless. Deinstalling.

name: Mel G
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Not very helpful. I've NEVER been alerted of being or coming into contact with someone whose known to have covid19. This app is just an invasion of my privacy!

name: R M
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Not very useful. The app only works, if someone who had or has COVID is using it too! It DOES NOT just detect people with Covid and alert you. I uninstalled it after a week of nothing and especially after 5 people tested positive where I work and the app never alerted me! It's really a waste of time.

name: Emily Luedeman
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Work in an emergency room and downloaded to see how accurate the alerts would be. I assumed I would have to turn off the notification from being alerted to much. To my surprise I haven't been alerted once in over a month of having the app even after being in direct patient care with positive cases.

name: Taxey Driver
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Not very useful.: 1. You must have and utilize a smart phone 2. You must have it activated 3. You must report your status daily 4. You must be in close contact with an infected person for too long and they must have reported they have symptons 5. Will it be compatable with apps from other states

name: Jordan Shi
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Cannot even finish setup poor development. Simple alert app should not be inconvenient to use if it is most people won't go through the headache of setting it up. This fix should be top priority. Poor development something like this should be more easily usable.

name: Lior Gotian
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Graphs of the data are basically useless without the ability to filter on the last 30 days. The data from March-April dominates the plotted ranges which makes it difficult to determine the actual covid cases and deaths that are occurring now.

name: Blank Biermanoski
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Once you tap on the option "Exposure Alert" to Activate, then you can't turn it off! And so it's using up my Data to perform checks when I'm all alone! I just Uninstalled the thing.
developer_comment: State of New Jersey  ApplicationsOctober 7, 2020Hi Jean, you can turn off Exposure Alerts at any time through settings in the operating system on your phone. The app has no way to access any of your other apps or any of your data besides the random codes it collects from other devices in the area with the app. If you have other questions about how the app works, please email covidapp@doh.nj.gov

name: Janet Kazarowski
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: I spend most of my time at home, and this app constantly harasses me to turn on my location. I use my phone a lot, and I don't want to waste the battery. This is more inconvenient to me than it is helpful.

name: Mayra Amaral
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: Can't get pass the 2nd screen during the setup process.error code 1002 (Your Data page) uninstalling until you get your act together and fix this.

name: Matthew Nichols
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: I get to the getting started screen and my phone freezes and then says app isn't responding. I've tried on WiFi, ice tried with WiFi off. Same result each time.

name: Joseph Merlino
ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

ratings: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
comment: After initial set-up, there is an "error 1002" code. The app has that one bug.

The exposure notification system does not require internet to function, so after set-up you can turn the Wi-Fi back on. We're working to fix this error now.

developer_comment: State of New Jersey  ApplicationsOctober 7, 2020Hi Will, this issue seems to be specific to a security setting on a specific type of Wi-Fi router. The app only requires internet for setup and loading statistics. The exposure notification system does not require internet to function, so after set-up you can turn the Wi-Fi back on. name: Lee Bruzaitis
ratings: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
comment: This app needs improvement. When you get an exposure alert it doesn't tell you the date of exposure, just that it was within the past 14 days. So you could already be out of the quarantine period or only need to test and isolate for a few days. Giving the date of exposure seems important.

name: Nancy Drewish
ratings: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
comment: Works ONLY: #1. If an infected person ALSO has the APP and you both have Bluetooth &. Location turned on. And #2. You come within 6 Feet for more than 10 minutes of an infected person AND #3 The infected person AGREES to allow the Tracers to access the app code information. What code? When your phone meets another phone ( see #1) a code is sent via bluetooth to both phones. The app remembers the code info. The tracer simply activates that code to send you an alert. Good for crowds etc.

name: Paul Karmazin
ratings: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
comment: During setup I realized that it requires both GPS and Bluetooth to be engaged. If I do this with my phone, it would die in 4 hours. I'm an emergency service personnel, I can't go with a dead phone all day. Sorry. Good idea but won't work for me.

name: Rahul Alam
ratings: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
comment: I understand needing location for the alerts but why would it need bluetooth? Modern day dependence on wireless devices destroys battery life as it is. I keep my Bluetooth, location and few other settings off unless I need to use them. Again, I understand location, but why bluetooth. *Anyone that doesn't know keep bluetooth wifi and nfc off unless you need it to keep yourself safe from hackers.

name: Geoffrey Turner
ratings: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
comment: Editing my review. The setup will fail if wifi is enabled and you will likely get the error 1006 as I did and noted in my original review. Turn off wifi per other reviewers suggestions and you should be fine. Giving 3 stars due to the poor qa and setup experience.
developer_comment: State of New Jersey  ApplicationsOctober 7, 2020We are really sorry for the trouble and we appreciate you bringing this issue to our attention. We are working to resolve the issue.

name: Alberto Hamade
ratings: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
comment: Still don't understand when to use covid Check-in button. Is it used when you have been diagnosed with covid, or do you just use it to let the system know you feel well regardless of whether you think you may have covid? I'm afraid of pressing the button because I feel like it will think I have Covid. Please explain in plain English what makes the app label you as covid positive.
developer_comment: State of New Jersey  ApplicationsOctober 7, 2020Hi Alberto, You will only be labeled as COVID positive if you receive a positive COVID test, receive a call from a contact tracer and agree to upload a positive verification pin to the app. The check-in button is a feature for people to use if they want to keep track of any new symptoms they have; you don't have to use it if you don't want to.

That way we can protect your privacy and not use GPS location tracking data, while still being able to figure out who may have been exposed to a COVID positive person.
